column4: No luck :/ I just did apt-get update and then checked if your thing was installed (it was) and then rebooted. dmesg says [   75.372118] b43legacy-phy0 ERROR: MAC suspend failed and the normal timeout thing...

uninstall and purge th e repo if you like. And Like I was talking about the last time that we talked if this did not work lets just try the b43 all by its lonesome :)     so      sudo apt-get remove bobsdriver firmware-b43legacy && sudo apt-get install firmware-b43-installer
make sure you uninstall bobsdriver thou 1st :) or it will not know what to do
Arite, I'm back at kb again, so I can sort this out. I've run that command, now I guess it's another reboot, right
yea Also make sure that you take out b43legacy out of /etc/modules
so it dont load on boot
